snippet: Steve Jobs is represented in a lot of parodies, rants, marketing hooks and memorials in the form of Twitter accounts under variations of his name.

abstract: An analysis of President Obama's tough choices on housing. | On Wall Street, its time to mend fences with the president. | Andrew Ross Sorkin said that the election won't solve all puzzles. | A big bets soured, imperiling a small firm. | A deal maker for Morgan Stanley was eased out. | HSBC may face charges in a laundering inquiry.

headline.main: Week in Review: On Wall Street, a New Tone With Old Tactics

snippet: After a reader challenged her to recreate a carrot and quinoa kugel, Martha Rose Shulman responded with five recipes for kugels made with grains.
abstract: After a reader challenged her to recreate a carrot and quinoa kugel, Martha Rose Shulman responded with five recipes for kugels made with grains.

snippet: People treated for Stage 3 disease, in which tumor cells have spread to lymph nodes, had less chance of dying of it or experiencing a recurrence if they choose foods like brown rice instead of white, or whole grains instead of white bread.
abstract: People treated for Stage 3 disease, in which tumor cells have spread to lymph nodes, had less chance of dying of it or experiencing a recurrence if they choose foods like brown rice instead of white, or whole grains instead of white bread.

headline.main: Can Foods Affect Colon Cancer Survival?

snippet: Friday ended the worst week for markets since June as investors turned their attention to the coming negotiations over impending tax increases and spending cuts.
abstract: Stocks advance slightly but fail to avert the worst week for markets since June, as investors turn their attention from the presidential elections to coming negotiations over impending tax increases and spending cuts.

headline.main: Shares Edge Up as Budget Concern Clashes With Strong Economic Data
headline.print_headline: Shares Edge Up as Budget Concern Clashes With Strong Economic Data

snippet: There's a big difference between protecting a concept for a new business and protecting a highly differentiated methodology.
abstract: There's a big difference between protecting a concept for a new business and protecting a highly differentiated methodology.

snippet: Competitions like the X Prize offer large sums of money to spur new approaches to seemingly insoluble problems; several MacArthur fellows were asked to propose prizes of their own.

headline.main: Imaginary Prizes Take Aim at Real Problems
headline.print_headline: Imaginary Prizes Take Aim at Real Problems

keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Dependent on the streams of customers drawn to the neighborhood by Fairway, which was damaged in Hurricane Sandy, the surrounding small businesses wait and worry.
abstract: Small businesses in Red Hook, Brooklyn, which depend on steady stream of customers drawn to the neighborhood by Fairway Market, are suffering as the 52,000-square-foot waterfront grocery store remains closed after flooding from Hurricane Sandy; Fairway, the lifeblood of the neighborhood, is not expected to reopen for months.

headline.main: Small Shops Shiver in Gloom of a Shuttered Red Hook Market
headline.print_headline: Small Shops Shiver in Gloom of a Shuttered Red Hook Market
